message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description of the rash suggests psoriasis, which is a chronic autoimmune condition. In this case, the patient has experienced an acute worsening of symptoms, which may require more than just topical treatment. Methotrexate is a first-line systemic therapy for psoriasis, which can help reduce inflammation and alleviate symptoms. Skin biopsy may confirm the diagnosis, but treatment can be initiated based on clinical presentation. Phototherapy or biologic agents like infliximab may be considered if methotrexate is not effective or contraindicated.

The next best step in management is to start treatment with methotrexate. Skin biopsy may be done if there is diagnostic uncertainty. Phototherapy and infliximab are also possible treatments, but methotrexate is typically tried first.
